author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Pianist Lang Lang implements music education program
text:
Donald Trail Pianist Lang Lang speaks to a student at Roberto Clemente Public School in Brooklyn. Pianist Lang Lang has partnered with the Roberto Clemente Public School in Brooklyn to implement a music education program, which he hopes will encourage piano playing and social development in elementary school children.
His foundation, which he started in 2008, has already implemented the “Keys of Inspiration” programs in Boston, San Diego and PS 46 in Harlem.
 “I want to bring arts to public schools, show that music is important,” he said.
The curriculum includes a new approach to teaching classical music.
“The children wear headphones while they are being taught the piano, so teacher becomes a DJ too," he said via phone.
 The Chinese pianist’s career includes performances at this year’s Grammys (with Pharrell) and at the opening of the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing.
Donald Trail Pianist Lang Lang gives a high five to a student at Roberto Clemente Public School in Brooklyn. He calls Pharrell a “wonderful musician and producer” who he hopes to work with again.
“As an artist he’s very open to classical music, especially since he’s not from that musical genre.”
He’s also formed another friendship with R&B singer John Legend, another skilled pianist.
“I'm hoping to make a [crossover] album with some of my good friends in the music world.”
Lang Lang will perform Friday at Carnegie Hall.
